definitions.definition: Any of several unrelated fish.
An upstart.
An elaterid; a click beetle.
A shallow sailboat with a rectilinear or V-shaped cross section.
Suitable for some particular purpose.
definitions.example: This would be an opportune spot for a picnic.

definitions.definition: At a convenient or advantageous time.
definitions.example: The opportune arrival of the bus cut short the boring conversation.

definitions.definition: A fruit-bearing shrub of the species Rubus fruticosus and some hybrids.
The soft fruit borne by this shrub, formed of a black (when ripe) cluster of drupelets.
The blackcurrant.
To gather or forage for blackberries.
A condiment sauce and ingredient, common in Asian cuisine, made from fermented soybeans, salt, and sometimes wheat.
A person who writes in support of one opinion, doctrine, or system, in opposition to another; one skilled in polemics; a controversialist; a disputant.
An argument or controversy.
A strong verbal or written attack on someone or something.
Having the characteristics of a polemic.
To make solid; convert into a solid body.
To concentrate; consolidate.
To become solid; to freeze, set.
A plan, desire, or idea that will not likely work; a near impossibility.
definitions.example: I think that his plan to become a professional athlete is a pipe dream and that he should stay in school.

definitions.definition: An instance of telling someone off, a reprimand or scolding.
A round plate-like object that is thrown for sport.
The athletics sport of discus throwing.
(plural: discus) A discus fish (genus Symphysodon)
A chakram.
Compassionate for another's distress
Easily moved to love
Quickly and critically discerning.
Shrewd or crafty.
A snack made of a cooked chicken wing with spicy sauce.
The liquid left over after producing butter from full cream milk by the churning process, also called traditional buttermilk.
Cultured buttermilk, a fermented dairy product produced from cow's milk, with a characteristically sour taste.
A sea-going vessel riding at anchor in a road or bay.
A clumsy vessel that works its way from one anchorage to another by means of the tides.
A horse for riding or driving on the road.
A bicycle, or tricycle, adapted for common roads, rather than for the racing track, usually of classic style and steel-framed construction.
One who drives much; a coach driver.
A hunter who keeps to the roads instead of following the hounds across country.
An open automobile having a front seat and a rumble seat.
A person who lives along the road.
Anything (such as a piece of furniture, or a software feature) that is built in, not added as an extra.
Constructed as a non-detachable part of a larger structure.
Being an essential and permanent part of something.
Being an included feature that normally comes as an extra.
A profound and persistent unhappiness related to characteristics associated with one's birth-assigned sex, experienced by some transgender people. Opposite of gender euphoria.
A slow or labored walk or other motion or activity.
definitions.example: We started at a brisk walk and ended at a plod.

definitions.definition: To walk or move slowly and heavily or laboriously (+ on, through, over).
To trudge over or through.
To toil; to drudge; especially, to study laboriously and patiently.
A puddle.
(mildly, usually with "the") the police, police officers
(mildly) a police officer, especially a low-ranking one.
A harsh penalty or settlement imposed upon a defeated party by the victor
A dogmatic decree, especially issued by one who rules without popular consent
Confined to bed because of infirmity or illness.
Displaying genius or brilliance; tending to invent.
definitions.example: This fellow is ingenious; he fixed a problem I didn't even know I had.

definitions.definition: Characterized by genius; cleverly done or contrived.
definitions.example: That is an ingenious model of the atom.

definitions.definition: Witty; original; shrewd; adroit; keen; sagacious.
definitions.example: He sent me an ingenious reply for an email.

definitions.definition: That cannot be read or is not easy to read.
definitions.example: a machine that cut up secret documents into small unreadable fragments

definitions.definition: Not sufficiently interesting to be worth reading.
definitions.example: unreadable books

definitions.definition: Any turbulent or frothy water as found in river rapids or surf.
definitions.example: The boat's wake left two strands of white water that glistened in the moonlight.

definitions.definition: Turbulent conditions.
A machine that bundles.
An employee who bundles things together, such as boards for trimming and stacking.
One who bundles software, etc. with another product.
Insolent and shameless audacity.
definitions.example: We even had the effrontery to suggest that he should leave the country.

definitions.definition: An act of insolent and shameless audacity.
definitions.example: Any refusal to salute the president shall be counted as an effrontery.

definitions.definition: To record in advance.
A system of points when a predetermined amount is accumulated by a player character, causes them to level up. This is one of the core mechanics of many role-playing games. Abbreviations: EXP or XP.
A standard collection of first aid supplies for treatment of minor injuries or stabilization of major injuries.
A person whose lifestyle is centered on motorcycles, sometimes a member of a motorcycle club.
Cyclist
A tomato-vinegar-based sauce, sometimes containing spices, onion or garlic, and (especially in the US) sweeteners.
Such a sauce more generally (not necessarily based on tomatoes).
definitions.example: fish ketchup; fruit ketchup; mushroom ketchup

definitions.definition: To cover with ketchup.
(massage) A person (especially male) who performs massage.
An instrument used in the performance of massage.

A weather phenomenon in the northwestern Pacific that is precisely equivalent to a hurricane, which results in wind speeds of 64 knots (118 km/h) or above. Equivalent to a cyclone in the Indian Ocean and Indonesia/Australia.
To swirl like a hurricane.
A vibrant light blue colour, like that of the sky on a fine day.
Of a vibrant light blue colour, like that of the sky on a fine day.
Ascot tie
To wither; to become, or make, lean and wrinkled by shrinkage, as from age or illness.
Withered; lean and wrinkled by shrinkage as from age or illness.
From which caffeine has been removed (e.g. decaffeinated coffee).
Laurus nobilis, an evergreen shrub having aromatic leaves of a lanceolate shape, with clusters of small, yellowish white flowers in their axils.
A crown of laurel.
(chiefly in the plural) Honor, distinction, fame.
definitions.example: to win laurels; to crown with laurels

definitions.definition: Any plant of the family Lauraceae.
Any of various plants of other families that resemble laurels.
An English gold coin made in 1619, and so called because the king's head on it was crowned with laurel.
To decorate with laurel, especially with a laurel wreath.
To enwreathe.
To award top honours to.
A person who intentionally instigates, incites, or starts something, especially one that creates trouble.
Implied indirectly, without being directly expressed
Contained in the essential nature of something but not openly shown
Having no reservations or doubts; unquestioning or unconditional; usually said of faith or trust.
Entangled, twisted together.
A pill or tablet having a soporific effect.
A form of theatrical entertainment in which recent events, popular fads, etc., are parodied. Any entertainment featuring skits, dances, and songs.
A naval mine attached to its target by magnets.
One who wades.
(chiefly in the plural) A waterproof boot that comes up to the hip, used by fishermen, etc.
A long-legged bird associated with wetland or coastal environments.
To rule over or control arbitrarily or arrogantly; to tyrannize.
The act of one who domineers.
Overbearing, dictatorial or authoritarian
The person who stood for a child during a naming ceremony or baptism
A godfather or godmother
One who cares for a child if untimely demise is met by the parents
The quality or degree of being toxic.
Difficulty or trouble; hard times.
definitions.example: He has survived periods of financial hardship before.

definitions.definition: To treat (a person) badly; to subject to hardships.
Tofu.
To make (something) sickly.
To become sickly.
Frequently ill or in poor health.
definitions.example: a sickly child

definitions.definition: Not in good health; (somewhat) sick.
(of a plant) Characterized by poor or unhealthy growth.
Appearing ill, infirm or unhealthy; giving the appearance of illness.
definitions.example: a sickly pallor

definitions.definition: Shedding a relatively small amount of light; (of light) not very bright.
Lacking intensity or vigour.
definitions.example: a sickly smile

definitions.definition: Associated with poor moral or mental well-being.
Tending to produce nausea.
definitions.example: a sickly smell; sickly sentimentality

definitions.definition: Overly sweet.
Marked by the occurrence of illness or disease (of a period of time).
Tending to produce disease or poor health.
definitions.example: a sickly autumn; a sickly climate

definitions.definition: In a sick manner; in a way that reflects or causes sickness.
definitions.example: sickly pale; to cough sickly

definitions.definition: An athlete who competes in the heptathlon.
A Rhenish wine, of a light yellow color, either sparkling or still, from the Hochheim region; often applied to all Rhenish wines.
The tarsal joint of a digitigrade quadruped, such as a horse, pig or dog.
Meat from that part of a food animal.
To disable by cutting the tendons of the hock; to hamstring; to hough.
Pawn, obligation as collateral for a loan.
definitions.example: He needed $750 to get his guitar out of hock at the pawnshop.

definitions.definition: Debt.
definitions.example: They were in hock to the bank for $35 million.

definitions.definition: Installment purchase.
Prison.
To leave with a pawnbroker as security for a loan.
To bother; to pester; to annoy incessantly
To cough heavily, esp. causing uvular frication.
A person who windsurfs.
Any of the genus Rumex of coarse weedy plants with small green flowers related to buckwheat, especially common dock, and used as potherbs and in folk medicine, especially in curing nettle rash.
A burdock plant, or the leaves of that plant.
The fleshy root of an animal's tail.
The part of the tail which remains after the tail has been docked.
The buttocks or anus.
A leather case to cover the clipped or cut tail of a horse.
To cut off a section of an animal's tail, to practise a caudectomy.
To reduce (wages); to deduct from.
To cut off, bar, or destroy.
definitions.example: to dock an entail

definitions.definition: A fixed structure attached to shore to which a vessel is secured when in port.
A structure attached to shore for loading and unloading vessels.
The body of water between two piers.
The place of arrival and departure of a train in a railway station.
A section of a hotel or restaurant.
definitions.example: coffee dock

definitions.definition: A device designed as a base for holding a connected portable appliance such as a laptop computer (in this case, referred to as a docking station), or a mobile telephone, for providing the necessary electrical charge for its autonomy, or as a hardware extension for additional capabilities.
A toolbar that provides the user with a way of launching applications, and switching between running applications.
An act of docking; joining two things together.
To land at a harbour.
To join two moving items.
To drag a user interface element (such as a toolbar) to a position on screen where it snaps into place.
To place (an electronic device) in its dock.
definitions.example: I docked the laptop and allowed it to recharge for an hour.

definitions.definition: Part of a courtroom where the accused sits.
To pierce with holes, as pricking pastry or dough with a fork to prevent excessive rising in the oven.
In a subjective manner.
Extremely overweight, especially: weighing more than 20% (for men) or 25% (for women) over their ideal weight determined by height and build; or, having a body mass index over 30 kg/m2.
A small circular or oblong boat made of wickerwork and made watertight with hides or pitch, propelled and steered with a single paddle and light enough to be carried on a person's back.
Coastal water body where ocean tides and river water merge, resulting in a brackish water zone.
An ocean inlet also fed by fresh river water.
A brake which can be used by passengers in a vehicle to stop in event of an emergency.
The area extending twenty yards from the end zone, where a team in possession of the ball is expected to score.
(California) An area of a street where the curb has been painted red, indicating that stopping, standing or parking is prohibited at that spot (except, in some places, for buses).
To test the look or fit of (a garment) by wearing it.
To attempt; to undertake.
A muscle controlling the eye's accommodation for viewing objects at varying distances
A trembling or quivering, especially one caused by emotion.
A cause of sudden excitement; a kick.
A slight quivering of the heart that accompanies a cardiac murmur.
A breathing place or hole; a nostril, as of a bird.
To suddenly excite someone, or to give someone great pleasure; to (figuratively) electrify; to experience such a sensation.
To (cause something to) tremble or quiver.
To perforate by a pointed instrument; to bore; to transfix; to drill.
To hurl; to throw; to cast.
To drill and thread in one operation, using a tool bit that cuts the hole and the threads in one series of computer-controlled movements.
A craggy outcrop of rock on the summit of a hill, created by the erosion and weathering of rock.
(South-West England) A hill with such rock formation.
A tower; a turret.
Hard, difficult; wearisome, tedious.
Strong, sturdy; great, massive.
Full; rich.
Mental or bodily distress.
Something that disturbs one’s comfort; an annoyance.
To cause annoyance or distress to.
To discourage; to deject.
(logistics) An inbound shipment.
To pass a ball inbounds
definitions.example: Smith inbounds the ball to Johnson.

definitions.definition: Within bounds
Into the inbounds area
definitions.example: She passed the ball inbounds.

definitions.definition: An oval cooking-pot, traditionally used in Provence.
A Provençal dish of layered baked vegetables.
Naive and trusting.
Demonstrating childlike simplicity.
Unsophisticated; clumsy or obvious.
Unable to mask one's feelings.
Straightforward, candid, open, and frank.
That or who refers to itself or oneself.
(specifically) In a literary work: referring to the author or the author's other works.
Meeting standards for safe flight
definitions.example: Doc Savage doubted that he would carry out the threat, and thought the plane was still airworthy.

definitions.definition: A prisoner or an ex-prisoner
The literal wheel of a cart.
A gymnastic maneuver whereby the gymnast rotates to one side or the other while keeping arms and legs outstretched, spinning for one or more revolutions.
A crown coin; its value, 5 shillings.
A silver dollar of the larger size produced before 1979.
To perform the gymnastics feat of a cartwheel.
To flip end over end: normally said of a crashing vehicle or aircraft.
definitions.example: The race car hit a bump and cartwheeled over the finish line.

definitions.definition: One who is the progeny of a specified person, at any distance of time or through any number of generations.
definitions.example: The patriarch survived many descendants: five children, a dozen grandchildren, even a great grandchild.

definitions.definition: A thing that derives directly from a given precursor or source.
definitions.example: This famous medieval manuscript has many descendants.

definitions.definition: A later evolutionary type.
definitions.example: Dogs evolved as descendants of early wolves.

definitions.definition: A language that is descended from another.
definitions.example: English and Scots are the descendants of Old English.

definitions.definition: A word or form in one language that is descended from a counterpart in an ancestor language.
Descending from a biological ancestor.
Proceeding from a figurative ancestor or source.
A unit of a housing co-operative; a purchased apartment where the apartment owners collectively are responsible for maintenance of common areas and upkeep.
Any co-operative, including housing, retail, utility, agricultural, banking or worker cooperatives.
Any shop owned by a co-operative.
A co-operative game, as opposed to a competitive game or deathmatch.
To work or act together, especially for a common purpose or benefit.
To allow for mutual unobstructed action
To function in harmony, side by side
To engage in economic cooperation.
(usually in the plural) A little schoolboy, either in grade or size.
A class or school for young schoolboys.
An outhouse: an outbuilding used as a lavatory.
Little, small, secondary in rank or importance.
Insignificant, trifling, or inconsiderable.
definitions.example: a petty fault

definitions.definition: Narrow-minded, small-minded.
Begrudging in nature, especially over insignificant matters.
definitions.example: That corporation is only slightly pettier than they are greedy, and they are overdue to reap the consequences.

definitions.definition: Pertaining to, or caused by, gravity or gravitation.
A plastic surgical procedure to alter the appearance of the nose, especially for cosmetic reasons; the resulting physical appearance of the nose.
To make worse (a problem, bad situation, negative feeling, etc.); aggravate; exasperate.
definitions.example: The proposed shutdown would exacerbate unemployment problems.

definitions.definition: A document issued by an educational institution testifying that the recipient has earned a degree or has successfully completed a particular course of study.
To act in an exaggerated manner.
definitions.example: He overacted his part.

definitions.definition: To act upon, or influence, unduly.
An animal seen as being without human reason; a senseless beast.
A person with the characteristics of an unthinking animal; a coarse or brutal person.
definitions.example: One of them was a hulking brute of a man, heavily tattooed and with a hardened face that practically screamed "I just got out of jail."

definitions.definition: (Cambridge University slang) One who has not yet matriculated.
To shape (diamonds) by grinding them against each other.
Without reason or intelligence (of animals).
definitions.example: a brute beast

definitions.definition: Characteristic of unthinking animals; senseless, unreasoning (of humans).
Being unconnected with intelligence or thought; purely material, senseless.
definitions.example: the brute earth; the brute powers of nature

definitions.definition: Crude, unpolished.
Strong, blunt, and spontaneous.
definitions.example: I punched him with brute force.

definitions.definition: Brutal; cruel; fierce; ferocious; savage; pitiless.
definitions.example: brute violence

definitions.definition: To disseminate, promulgate, or spread news, a rumour, etc.
A common East Asian liquid sauce, made by subjecting boiled beans to long fermentation and then long digestion in salt and water.
definitions.example: I like a little soy with my rice.

definitions.definition: Soybeans, or the protein derived from them.
definitions.example: The soy crop is looking good this year.

definitions.definition: To make angry.
To make insane; to inflame with passion.
To become furious.
Riverboarding
An adult castrated male of cattle (B. taurus).
Any bovine animal (genus Bos). A neat, a beef.
